titleStmt.title: The collectors of the old clothes for the distressed Protestants in Ireland, doe, (to the glory of God, the comfort and praise of these charitable and well affected people of the citty of London) signifie that they have received as much clothing as will cover the nakednes of about 12. thousand poore soules ...

notesStmt.note: Title from opening words of text.
Dated 1642 at end. Place of publication conjectured by Wing.
Reproduction of original in the Henry E. Huntington Library.
